sentence.Network_en: He then held the man in an armlock until police arrived.
sentence.Network_cn: 然后他反扭住那名男子的手臂让他动弹不得，直到警察赶到。

sentence.Network_en: He waited until all the luggage was cleared, but Paula's never appeared.
sentence.Network_cn: 他一直等到所有的行李都拿走了，但始终没看见葆拉的。

sentence.Network_en: It remained an exceptionally rare book until it was reprinted in 1918.
sentence.Network_cn: 在1918年再版之前，这本书一直非常罕见。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old Norse und 'as far as' + till (the sense thus duplicated)

entry.def: If something happens until a particular time, it happens during the period before that time and stops at that time.

example.ex: Until 1982 he was senior lecturer in botany at Durham University.
example.tran: 1982年以前他一直是达勒姆大学生物系的高级讲师。

example.ex: ...consumers who have waited until after the Christmas holiday to do that holiday shopping.
example.tran: 等到过完圣诞节才进行节日采购的顾客

entry.tran: （与否定词连用）直到…之前，直到…为止，除非
entry.def: You use until with a negative to emphasize the moment in time after which the rest of your statement becomes true, or the condition which would make it true.

example.ex: The traffic laws don't take effect until the end of the year...
example.tran: 交通法要到年底才生效。

example.ex: It was not until 1911 that the first of the vitamins was identified.
example.tran: 直到1911年才发现了第一种维生素。

Sentence.sentence: But chariots maintained their place in parades and triumphs right up until the end of the Roman Empire 1,500 years later.
But steamships didn't lose their sails until the 1880s, because early marine engines had a nasty habit of breaking down
Until ships became large enough (and engines small enough) to mount two engines side by side, they needed to keep sails.
The first is"If I purchase a corporate bond,do I have to hold it until the maturity date?
